name: LaShawn Daniels
description: '''LaShawn Ameen Daniels''' (December 28, 1977 – September 3, 2019) was an American songwriter, vocal producer and arranger. Often in tandem with producer [[Rodney Jerkins]], he is known for his songwriting work for [[Contemporary R&B|R&B]] singers such as [[Brandy Norwood|Brandy]], [[Beyoncé]], [[Michael Jackson]],  [[Tamar Braxton]], [[Toni Braxton]], [[Jennifer Lopez]], [[Ciara]], and [[Whitney Houston]], among others. Daniels won a [[Grammy Award]]—from nine nominations—for his work on [[Destiny's Child]]'s 1999 single "[[Say My Name]]", which peaked [[List of Billboard Hot 100 number-one singles of 1999|atop the ''Billboard'' Hot 100]].
